carousel_items: Neulasta stimulates a certain type of white blood cell important in fighting infection. It's injected under the skin (subcutaneous) beginning 24-72 hours after you finish your cancer medicine treatment.
Pain or redness in the area of injection is common. Let your doctor know if you notice a lump, swelling, or bruising that doesn't go away.
Most common side effect is aches/pain in your muscles and bones. Take Tylenol or other non-aspirin pain reliever.
Serious and life-threatening spleen, lung, allergic reactions and sickle cell crisis can happen immediately, days or months after starting Neulasta.
Use effective birth control while you're taking Neulasta. If you do become pregnant enroll in Amgen's Pregnancy Surveillance Program.
Tell your doctor if you have an allergy to latex. The prefilled syringe needle cover contains a latex product.

Store Neulasta in the refrigerator (not in the freezer), protect from light and don't shake it. For a more comfortable injection, leave the syringe at room temperature for 30 minutes before injecting.
Don't inject if Neulasta contains any particles, is discolored or foamy.
Don't inject into skin that's red, bruised or irritated. Rotate your injection areas using front of the thigh, outer area of upper arms or lower part of your belly (not around belly button).
Store away from children and dispose of used syringes or syringes left at room temperature for more than 48 hours in a protective (Sharps) container. DON'T throw in the trash.

basics.benefits_moa: Neulasta is a colony-stimulating factor (blood cell booster) that's similar to a protein your body makes naturally. It works to boost the number of certain white blood cells called neutrophils and makes them grow faster. Neutrophils help your body fight infection.
basics.bottom_line: Neulasta can lower your risk of infection during chemotherapy, and the injections are less frequent than some alternatives.
downsides: If you decide not to self-inject and don't have someone to do it for you, you'll need to have your doctor or trained medical staff give you each dose.
You'll need to properly dispose of the needle and syringe in a special (FDA-approved) sharps container.

downsides_processed.orig: If you decide not to self-inject and don't have someone to do it for you, you'll need to have your doctor or trained medical staff give you each dose.
You'll need to properly dispose of the needle and syringe in a special (FDA-approved) sharps container.

upsides: Neulasta has a longer duration of effect compared to a similar medicine, Neupogen. It's a larger molecule so it stays in the body longer and is slowly removed by the kidney.
Only needs to be given once with each chemotherapy cycle compared to daily injections.

Studies show less people who took Neulasta had fever with low white blood cell count (neutropenia) compared to people who didn't take it initially. They went to the hospital less and needed less intravenous medicine to fight infections.

upsides_processed.orig: Neulasta has a longer duration of effect compared to a similar medicine, Neupogen. It's a larger molecule so it stays in the body longer and is slowly removed by the kidney.
Only needs to be given once with each chemotherapy cycle compared to daily injections.

Studies show less people who took Neulasta had fever with low white blood cell count (neutropenia) compared to people who didn't take it initially. They went to the hospital less and needed less intravenous medicine to fight infections.

drugs.name: Neulasta

carousel_items_processed.orig: Neulasta stimulates a certain type of white blood cell important in fighting infection. It's injected under the skin (subcutaneous) beginning 24-72 hours after you finish your cancer medicine treatment.
Pain or redness in the area of injection is common. Let your doctor know if you notice a lump, swelling, or bruising that doesn't go away.
Most common side effect is aches/pain in your muscles and bones. Take Tylenol or other non-aspirin pain reliever.
Serious and life-threatening spleen, lung, allergic reactions and sickle cell crisis can happen immediately, days or months after starting Neulasta.
Use effective birth control while you're taking Neulasta. If you do become pregnant enroll in Amgen's Pregnancy Surveillance Program.
Tell your doctor if you have an allergy to latex. The prefilled syringe needle cover contains a latex product.

Store Neulasta in the refrigerator (not in the freezer), protect from light and don't shake it. For a more comfortable injection, leave the syringe at room temperature for 30 minutes before injecting.
Don't inject if Neulasta contains any particles, is discolored or foamy.
Don't inject into skin that's red, bruised or irritated. Rotate your injection areas using front of the thigh, outer area of upper arms or lower part of your belly (not around belly button).

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Neulasta has been reported to cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). Most cases happened right away, but it can happen days after you stop the medicine even if you were treated with anti-allergy medicine. If you notice these symptoms after your injection or days later, call your doctor and get medical care right away.

description_processed.orig: Neulasta has been reported to cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). Most cases happened right away, but it can happen days after you stop the medicine even if you were treated with anti-allergy medicine. If you notice these symptoms after your injection or days later, call your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: Respiratory problems
risks_warnings.description: Neulasta can cause a serious breathing condition known as Respiratory Distress Syndrome (RDS). You'll need to get medical care right away if you have shortness of breath, fast rate of breathing or trouble breathing.

description_processed.orig: Neulasta can cause a serious breathing condition known as Respiratory Distress Syndrome (RDS). You'll need to get medical care right away if you have shortness of breath, fast rate of breathing or trouble breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Spleen problems
risks_warnings.description: Although rare, Neulasta can cause your spleen to become enlarged or rupture (break open).  A ruptured spleen is very serious and can cause death. Call your doctor and get medical care right away if you have pain in the upper left stomach area or shoulder pain.

description_processed.orig: Although rare, Neulasta can cause your spleen to become enlarged or rupture (break open).  A ruptured spleen is very serious and can cause death. Call your doctor and get medical care right away if you have pain in the upper left stomach area or shoulder pain.

risks_warnings.title: Blood problems
risks_warnings.description: Make sure your doctor knows if you have a condition called sickle cell disorder. Neulasta can trigger serious and even fatal sickle cell crisis (unexplained or severe pain in the belly, chest, bones or joints, shortness of breath, fast rate of breathing or trouble breathing). Get medical care right away if have you these symptoms while taking Neulasta.
risk_factors: Sickle cell crisis while taking filgrastim

description_processed.orig: Make sure your doctor knows if you have a condition called sickle cell disorder. Neulasta can trigger serious and even fatal sickle cell crisis (unexplained or severe pain in the belly, chest, bones or joints, shortness of breath, fast rate of breathing or trouble breathing). Get medical care right away if have you these symptoms while taking Neulasta.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Neulasta hasn’t been studied in pregnant women so the effects on your unborn baby are unknown.  If you take it during pregnancy or breastfeed, it’s possible that some medicine may get into your baby’s blood.  Talk to your doctor first. If you get pregnant while taking Neulasta you should enroll in Amgen’s Pregnancy Surveillance Program.

description_processed.orig: Neulasta hasn’t been studied in pregnant women so the effects on your unborn baby are unknown.  If you take it during pregnancy or breastfeed, it’s possible that some medicine may get into your baby’s blood.  Talk to your doctor first. If you get pregnant while taking Neulasta you should enroll in Amgen’s Pregnancy Surveillance Program.

risks_warnings.title: Malignancy
risks_warnings.description: Because Neulasta is a growth factor there is an unknown possibility for it to make other types of tumors (myeloid cell lines) grow. Talk to your doctor if you have a history of myeloid cancer or myelodysplastic condition before starting treatment.
risk_factors: History of myeloid cancers or myelodysplastic conditions

description_processed.orig: Because Neulasta is a growth factor there is an unknown possibility for it to make other types of tumors (myeloid cell lines) grow. Talk to your doctor if you have a history of myeloid cancer or myelodysplastic condition before starting treatment.

points.name: Pain in extremity
points.hlt: musculoskeletal and connective tissue pain and discomfort

carousel_items: If you notice pain in your Achilles tendons, contact your doctor.
Wear sunscreen if you're going to be out in the sun.
Take the medication exactly how the doctor tells you to.
Take this medication with plenty of fluids.
Space out any medications containing aluminum, magnesium or zinc by at least 2 hours.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Can cause changes in taste, headaches and insomnia.

basics.benefits_moa: Levofloxacin is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from reproducing and repairing themselves.
basics.bottom_line: Levofloxacin is good for treating many bacterial infections and is available as generic. However, it can cause damage to your tendons, and make your skin more sensitive to the sun.
downsides: Must be used with caution in people over 60 years of age, or who have had either an organ transplant or on long-term steroid use due to possible tendon rupture.
Levofloxacin can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Can't be used if you've ever had myasthenia gravis.
You have to space out any medications with aluminum, magnesium or zinc by at least 2 hours.
Can cause changes in taste, headaches, and insomnia.

downsides_processed.orig: Must be used with caution in people over 60 years of age, or who have had either an organ transplant or on long-term steroid use due to possible tendon rupture.
Levofloxacin can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Can't be used if you've ever had myasthenia gravis.
You have to space out any medications with aluminum, magnesium or zinc by at least 2 hours.
Can cause changes in taste, headaches, and insomnia.

upsides: Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen in bacteria to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see which antibiotics will kill the bacteria causing your infection.

upsides_processed.orig: Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen in bacteria to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see which antibiotics will kill the bacteria causing your infection.

userStories.tip: It ruined multiple tendons in both my hands. I had to have the tendons surgically repaired. After that I developed tendon damage in both legs and my rotator cuff-but it totally cleared up my sinus infection!

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: I stopped taking this medicine after I started having pain in my achilles tendon. I was afraid my tendon would rupture and that I would never be comfortable running again. The pain lasted for a few weeks! Don't take it unless you have to!

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: Had to stop after 3 days. Serious side effects. Too strong for me!

Do not take this medication! It will mess up your joints/tendons and cause multiple other problems. There are several FB groups with 1000's of victims from being "Floxed".  Cipro causes same damage also! Do your Research before taking!!!
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

drugs.name: Levaquin

carousel_items_processed.orig: If you notice pain in your Achilles tendons, contact your doctor.
Wear sunscreen if you're going to be out in the sun.
Take the medication exactly how the doctor tells you to.
Take this medication with plenty of fluids.
Space out any medications containing aluminum, magnesium or zinc by at least 2 hours.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Can cause changes in taste, headaches and insomnia.

risks_warnings.title: Tendon rupture
risks_warnings.description: If you notice redness/inflammation, pain or swelling in your joints or muscles, especially in the Achilles tendon, contact your doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: If you notice redness/inflammation, pain or swelling in your joints or muscles, especially in the Achilles tendon, contact your doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Rash
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of liver damage that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor if you notice pain in your abdomen, loss of appetite, yellowing of your skin or eyes, or dark colored urine.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of liver damage that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor if you notice pain in your abdomen, loss of appetite, yellowing of your skin or eyes, or dark colored urine.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: If you've had seizures, taking Levofloxacin can make you more likely to have them. Talk to your doctor about alternatives.

description_processed.orig: If you've had seizures, taking Levofloxacin can make you more likely to have them. Talk to your doctor about alternatives.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in mood
risks_warnings.description: If you notice changes in your mood such as depression, nervousness, or mood swings after you start taking Levofloxacin, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: If you notice changes in your mood such as depression, nervousness, or mood swings after you start taking Levofloxacin, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Nerve damage
risks_warnings.description: Talk to your doctor immediately if you start to feel burning, tingling, numbness, pain or you can't tolerate heat or cold. This could be a sign of nerve damage. It can happen as soon as you start taking the medication and may not go away if you stop it.

description_processed.orig: Talk to your doctor immediately if you start to feel burning, tingling, numbness, pain or you can't tolerate heat or cold. This could be a sign of nerve damage. It can happen as soon as you start taking the medication and may not go away if you stop it.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: People with diabetes may notice changes in their blood sugar while taking Levofloxacin. Talk to your doctor if you should check your blood sugar more often, and follow what they tell you if it gets too high or too low.

description_processed.orig: People with diabetes may notice changes in their blood sugar while taking Levofloxacin. Talk to your doctor if you should check your blood sugar more often, and follow what they tell you if it gets too high or too low.

risks_warnings.title: Sunburn
risks_warnings.description: Your skin can be more likely to sunburn while you're on Levofloxacin. Avoid tanning or tanning beds, and put on sunblock if you have to be out in the sun.

description_processed.orig: Your skin can be more likely to sunburn while you're on Levofloxacin. Avoid tanning or tanning beds, and put on sunblock if you have to be out in the sun.

risks_warnings.title: Diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: As with all antibiotics, Levofloxacin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

description_processed.orig: As with all antibiotics, Levofloxacin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.
